pullRequest.title: mgr-setup: Added RHEL/CentOS compatibility.

nodes.bodyText:
Please add here also a check for not SUSE.
On SUSE systems this happens when starting the DB in the systemd start script (systemctl start postgresql).
You can check via /etc/os-release that ID_LIKE contains "suse":
if [ -e /etc/os-release ]; then
   . /etc/os-release
   if [[ "$ID_LIKE" = *"suse"* ]]; then
      echo "Do something for any SUSE/openSUSE distro"
   fi
fi
